20101229030110.000|20101229030112.000|TR0|Chaos at the airport as this week's 
20101229030112.000|20101229030114.000|TR0|monster blizzard leaves airline passengers 
20101229030114.000|20101229030116.000|TR0|stranded on the tarmac for hours on end.  
20101229030116.000|20101229030118.000|TR0|It's every traveler's worst nightmare, no 
20101229030118.000|20101229030120.000|TR0|food, no water, screaming babies, and 
20101229030120.000|20101229030122.000|TR0|frustrated passengers breaking down in 
20101229030122.000|20101229030124.000|TR0|tears -- not just on one flight, but four, 
20101229030124.000|20101229030126.000|TR0|all at New York's John F. Kennedy 
20101229030126.000|20101229030128.000|TR0|International Airport, all without gates 
20101229030128.000|20101229030131.000|TR0|to let their passengers off the plane, two 
20101229030131.000|20101229030133.000|TR0|Cathay Pacific flights, one stranded for a 
20101229030133.000|20101229030135.000|TR0|punishing 11 hours, a British Airways 
20101229030135.000|20101229030137.000|TR0|flight stranded seven hours, and an 
20101229030137.000|20101229030139.000|TR0|Aeromexico flight stuck for six hours.
20101229030139.000|20101229030141.000|TR0|
20101229030141.000|20101229030143.000|TR0|Why?  No one seems to know, but everyone 
20101229030143.000|20101229030145.000|TR0|is pointing fingers. The New York/New 
20101229030145.000|20101229030147.000|TR0|Jersey Port Authority oversees Kennedy, 
20101229030147.000|20101229030149.000|TR0|which is a major hub for air travelers 
20101229030149.000|20101229030152.000|TR0|from around the country and the world. The 
20101229030152.000|20101229030154.000|TR0|Port Authority claims the airlines are to 
20101229030154.000|20101229030156.000|TR0|blame.
20101229030156.000|20101229030158.000|TR0|
20101229030158.000|20101229030200.000|TR0|Quote: "The reason for the delay is 
20101229030200.000|20101229030202.000|TR0|because the airlines brought in the planes 
20101229030202.000|20101229030204.000|TR0|without checking with terminal operations 
20101229030204.000|20101229030206.000|TR0|to see if there was a place to put them.  
20101229030206.000|20101229030208.000|TR0|It is an airline's responsibility to 
20101229030208.000|20101229030210.000|TR0|contact the terminal before bringing in 
20101229030210.000|20101229030213.000|TR0|flights, and they did not."
20101229030213.000|20101229030215.000|TR0|
20101229030215.000|20101229030217.000|TR0|But Cathay Pacific isn't buying it.  Its 
20101229030217.000|20101229030219.000|TR0|spokesperson says, the airline's intention 
20101229030219.000|20101229030221.000|TR0|was -- quote -- "to get passengers to New 
20101229030221.000|20101229030223.000|TR0|York as quickly as possible, and we 
20101229030223.000|20101229030225.000|TR0|anticipated to have gate space available." 
20101229030225.000|20101229030227.000|TR0|    So, if it's not the airline or the 
20101229030227.000|20101229030229.000|TR0|airport's fault, who is it? Try U.S. 
20101229030229.000|20101229030232.000|TR0|customs.  Noting that each of the stranded

20101229030234.000|20101229030236.000|TR0|Port Authority also suggests that, on the

20101229030259.000|20101229030301.000|TR0|
20101229030301.000|20101229030303.000|TR0|Whatever the cause, what about that 
20101229030303.000|20101229030305.000|TR0|airline passenger bill of rights that's 
20101229030305.000|20101229030307.000|TR0|supposed to limit how much time passengers 
20101229030307.000|20101229030309.000|TR0|can sit on a tarmac?  Well, it turns out 
20101229030309.000|20101229030311.000|TR0|there are exceptions.  The rules don't 
20101229030311.000|20101229030314.000|TR0|apply if air traffic control determines

20101229030316.000|20101229030318.000|TR0|passengers should stay on the plane.

20101229030324.000|20101229030326.000|TR0|apply at all.  But, right now, holiday

20101229031102.000|20101229031104.000|TR0|was passed in April that lays out very 
20101229031104.000|20101229031106.000|TR0|specific rules that need to be followed in 
20101229031106.000|20101229031108.000|TR0|delays on the tarmac, including food and 
20101229031108.000|20101229031111.000|TR0|water after two hours.  Air-conditioning 
20101229031111.000|20101229031113.000|TR0|needs to be on.  Toilets need to be

20101229031544.000|20101229031546.000|TR0|KAYE:  One story we have been following 
20101229031546.000|20101229031548.000|TR0|closely here on 360 is the arrest and 
20101229031548.000|20101229031550.000|TR0|imprisonment of an American hospital 
20101229031550.000|20101229031552.000|TR0|volunteer in Haiti on an allegation that 
20101229031552.000|20101229031554.000|TR0|he practiced voodoo on a child.  His name 
20101229031554.000|20101229031556.000|TR0|is Paul Waggoner.
20101229031556.000|20101229031558.000|TR0|
20101229031558.000|20101229031601.000|TR0|He is accused of kidnapping a 15-month-old 
20101229031601.000|20101229031603.000|TR0|boy who in fact was seriously ill and died 
20101229031603.000|20101229031605.000|TR0|and then turning that child into a zombie. 
20101229031605.000|20101229031607.000|TR0|That's right, a zombie.  An American man 
20101229031607.000|20101229031609.000|TR0|who is not yet charged with a crime is 
20101229031609.000|20101229031611.000|TR0|being held in Haiti's notorious National

20101229031613.000|20101229031615.000|TR0|

20101229031617.000|20101229031619.000|TR0|which is under investigation, was made by 
20101229031619.000|20101229031622.000|TR0|the child's father, who tells people his 
20101229031622.000|20101229031624.000|TR0|son is alive.  A hearing was held today 
20101229031624.000|20101229031626.000|TR0|before an investigative magistrate, with 
20101229031626.000|20101229031628.000|TR0|both Waggoner and the father present.
20101229031628.000|20101229031630.000|TR0|
20101229031630.000|20101229031632.000|TR0|A colleague of Waggoner's telling CNN the 
20101229031632.000|20101229031634.000|TR0|hearing lasted about four hours, but was 
20101229031634.000|20101229031636.000|TR0|cut short due to a power outage.  No 
20101229031636.000|20101229031638.000|TR0|ruling was issued today, but Waggoner's 
20101229031638.000|20101229031640.000|TR0|supporters are hoping the judge may decide 
20101229031640.000|20101229031643.000|TR0|tomorrow to release him.
20101229031643.000|20101229031645.000|TR0|
20101229031645.000|20101229031647.000|TR0|Now, here's the background to this story 
20101229031647.000|20101229031649.000|TR0|and how it got to this point.  Back in 
20101229031649.000|20101229031651.000|TR0|February, a month after the earthquake 
20101229031651.000|20101229031653.000|TR0|devastated Haiti, Waggoner, whose nickname 
20101229031653.000|20101229031655.000|TR0|is "Little Paul," was volunteering at a 
20101229031655.000|20101229031657.000|TR0|hospital when a man walked in with his 
20101229031657.000|20101229031659.000|TR0|deathly-ill son, who did not survive.
20101229031659.000|20101229031702.000|TR0|
20101229031702.000|20101229031704.000|TR0|The father, Frantz Philistin, was asked to 
20101229031704.000|20101229031706.000|TR0|return the following day to claim the 
20101229031706.000|20101229031708.000|TR0|body.  American doctor Kenneth Adams was 
20101229031708.000|20101229031710.000|TR0|present at the hospital the next day.  In 
20101229031710.000|20101229031712.000|TR0|an affidavit, Dr. Adams states that when 
20101229031712.000|20101229031714.000|TR0|Philistin was shown the remains of his son 
20101229031714.000|20101229031716.000|TR0|-- quote -- "The father jokingly said that 
20101229031716.000|20101229031718.000|TR0|it looked like the baby was still alive, 
20101229031718.000|20101229031720.000|TR0|but I pulled out my stethoscope and 
20101229031720.000|20101229031723.000|TR0|listened carefully for any breath sounds 
20101229031723.000|20101229031725.000|TR0|or heartbeat.  And there was none."
20101229031725.000|20101229031727.000|TR0|
20101229031727.000|20101229031729.000|TR0|In addition, an official death certificate 
20101229031729.000|20101229031731.000|TR0|was filled out for little Keevins 
20101229031731.000|20101229031733.000|TR0|Philistin and signed by a hospital 
20101229031733.000|20101229031735.000|TR0|official.  The boy's body was cremated by 
20101229031735.000|20101229031737.000|TR0|the hospital because Frantz Philistin said 
20101229031737.000|20101229031739.000|TR0|he had no money to bury his son.
20101229031739.000|20101229031741.000|TR0|
20101229031741.000|20101229031744.000|TR0|A colleague said that Waggoner's only role 
20101229031744.000|20101229031746.000|TR0|that day was being present with Mr. 
20101229031746.000|20101229031748.000|TR0|Philistin when he viewed his son's body.  
20101229031748.000|20101229031750.000|TR0|Even the head of hospital security said 
20101229031750.000|20101229031752.000|TR0|Little Paul had nothing to do with the 
20101229031752.000|20101229031754.000|TR0|child's care.
20101229031754.000|20101229031756.000|TR0|
20101229031756.000|20101229031758.000|TR0|But, just weeks later, Philistin filed 
20101229031758.000|20101229031800.000|TR0|complaints against Waggoner and two 
20101229031800.000|20101229031802.000|TR0|others.  They were cleared, but Waggoner 
20101229031802.000|20101229031805.000|TR0|was not.  A summons was issued for his 
20101229031805.000|20101229031807.000|TR0|arrest and he was jailed earlier this 
20101229031807.000|20101229031809.000|TR0|month.
20101229031809.000|20101229031811.000|TR0|
20101229031811.000|20101229031813.000|TR0|Last week, he released a letter from the 
20101229031813.000|20101229031815.000|TR0|National Penitentiary, saying -- quote -- 
20101229031815.000|20101229031817.000|TR0|"I am broken and can't understand why this 
20101229031817.000|20101229031819.000|TR0|is happening to me.  I have done nothing 
20101229031819.000|20101229031821.000|TR0|wrong.  Why can't anybody help me and get 
20101229031821.000|20101229031823.000|TR0|me out of here?  I'm scared I will never 
20101229031823.000|20101229031826.000|TR0|be released.  I have been moved and can no 
20101229031826.000|20101229031828.000|TR0|longer feel the sun on my skin.  It is so 
20101229031828.000|20101229031830.000|TR0|dark, and I am so afraid."
20101229031830.000|20101229031832.000|TR0|
20101229031832.000|20101229031834.000|TR0|Tonight, the State Department said that 
20101229031834.000|20101229031836.000|TR0|it's been providing consular assistance to 
20101229031836.000|20101229031838.000|TR0|Waggoner during his detention.  Meanwhile, 
20101229031838.000|20101229031840.000|TR0|Waggoner's colleague is Paul Sebring, who, 
20101229031840.000|20101229031842.000|TR0|incidentally, is nicknamed "Big Paul."  
20101229031842.000|20101229031844.000|TR0|He's in Port-au-Prince tonight.

20101229034629.000|20101229034631.000|TR0|DR. SANJAY GUPTA, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20101229034631.000|20101229034633.000|TR0|(voice-over):  The speed can reach over 
20101229034633.000|20101229034635.000|TR0|190 miles an hour.  The temperature inside 
20101229034635.000|20101229034637.000|TR0|the race car, 150 degrees.  Despite those 
20101229034637.000|20101229034639.000|TR0|extremes, and the usual fire-spitting 
20101229034639.000|20101229034641.000|TR0|crashes, Jennifer Jo Cobb feels right at 
20101229034641.000|20101229034644.000|TR0|home on the NASCAR racetrack. This 
20101229034644.000|20101229034646.000|TR0|up-and-coming driver is paving the way for 
20101229034646.000|20101229034648.000|TR0|aspiring female racers and making quite a 
20101229034648.000|20101229034650.000|TR0|name for herself.
20101229034650.000|20101229034652.000|TR0|

20101229034654.000|20101229034656.000|TR0|into NASCAR's elite series, Jennifer's 
20101229034656.000|20101229034658.000|TR0|2010 finish was the best ever, winning her 
20101229034658.000|20101229034700.000|TR0|$250,000.  Jennifer also owns her own team.
20101229034700.000|20101229034702.000|TR0|
